summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It chronicles his activities the day before, the discovery of his body, the medical response, notifications to officials and family, and the subsequent investigation by the FBI and OIG.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death by apparent suicide is the central subject of the timeline. He was visited by attorneys on August 9 and found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10 and later provided with a press release.

connections.description: Epstein was a defendant in a case presided over by Judge Berman, who was officially notified of Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day of Attorney Visits
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein spent the day in attorney conferences and was reported to be in good spirits during a social call in the evening.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm was activated in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated and continued by medical staff and EMS.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: At 7:36 am, the official time of death was reported by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital after Epstein was transported there.

events.title: Next of Kin Notification
events.description: At 11:00 am, Epstein's brother was notified of his death by the Case Management Coordinator.

events.title: FBI and OIG Investigation Initiated
events.description: The FBI was notified at 8:34 am and arrived at the institution later that day. The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was also notified and sent agents to investigate.

events.title: Evidence Collection
events.description: Computer hard drives were removed from the SHU and replaced with new ones late on August 10. On August 11, OIG agents departed with two computers as evidence.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
He had been visited by several attorneys and was reported to be in 'good spirits' during a social call the evening before his death.
He was pronounced dead at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019.
The FBI and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) were promptly notified and began an investigation, which included removing computer hard drives from the SHU as evidence.
Epstein's brother was notified of his death at 11:00 am on August 10.
